Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (13 ll.) and names of 16 witnesses on verso. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "sale of a share of land in Pathyris by three women (two of them sisters) to a "Greek born in Egypt" Petearsemtheus son of Panobchunis. Date. year 11 = 8 Mechir 16 of Cleopatra III and Ptol. Alexander = BC. 106 Mar. 3 [...] Cf. no. 10491".
Curator's comments: Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT. Ed. in S.E. Thomas Cambridge PhD diss. Text 21 in Shore's Manuscript Catalogue of Demotic Gebelein Papyri in the British Museum. Publication in progress (S.E. Thomas).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (331) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/331)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, loss Black ink Tabbed: glassine paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: cloth Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair
